intro: Justicia rothschuhii, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a soft, velvety texture. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Justicia rothschuhii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a container plant.
